tags.name: cases
tags.description: Case APIs enable you to open and track issues.

tags.name: kibana
tags.description: Kibana APIs enable you to interact with Kibana features.

post.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case you're creating.

connector.description: An object that contains the connector configuration.

fields.description: An object containing the connector fields. To create a case without a connector, specify null. If you want to omit any individual field, specify null as its value.

caseId.description: The case identifier for Swimlane connectors.

category.description: The category of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

destIp.description: A comma-separated list of destination IPs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

impact.description: The effect an incident had on business for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

issueType.description: The type of issue for Jira connectors.

issueTypes.description: The type of incident for IBM Resilient connectors.

malwareHash.description: A comma-separated list of malware hashes for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

malwareUrl.description: A comma-separated list of malware URLs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

parent.description: The key of the parent issue, when the issue type is sub-task for Jira connectors.

priority.description: The priority of the issue for Jira and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

severity.description: The severity of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

severityCode.description: The severity code of the incident for IBM Resilient connectors.

sourceIp.description: A comma-separated list of source IPs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

subcategory.description: The subcategory of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

urgency.description: The extent to which the incident resolution can be delayed for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

id.description: The identifier for the connector. To create a case without a connector, use `none`.

name.description: The name of the connector. To create a case without a connector, use `none`.

settings.description: An object that contains the case settings.

syncAlerts.description: Turns alert syncing on or off.

tags.description: The words and phrases that help categorize cases. It can be an empty array.

fields.description: An object containing the connector fields. To create a case without a connector, specify null. If you want to omit any individual field, specify null as its value.

caseId.description: The case identifier for Swimlane connectors.

category.description: The category of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

destIp.description: A comma-separated list of destination IPs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

impact.description: The effect an incident had on business for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

issueType.description: The type of issue for Jira connectors.

issueTypes.description: The type of incident for IBM Resilient connectors.

malwareHash.description: A comma-separated list of malware hashes for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

malwareUrl.description: A comma-separated list of malware URLs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

parent.description: The key of the parent issue, when the issue type is sub-task for Jira connectors.

priority.description: The priority of the issue for Jira and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

severity.description: The severity of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

severityCode.description: The severity code of the incident for IBM Resilient connectors.

sourceIp.description: A comma-separated list of source IPs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

subcategory.description: The subcategory of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

urgency.description: The extent to which the incident resolution can be delayed for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

id.description: The identifier for the connector. To create a case without a connector, use `none`.

name.description: The name of the connector. To create a case without a connector, use `none`.

duration.description: The elapsed time from the creation of the case to its closure (in seconds). If the case has not been closed, the duration is set to null. If the case was closed after less than half a second, the duration is rounded down to zero.

delete.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the cases you're deleting.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The cases that you want to removed. To retrieve case IDs, use the find cases API. All non-ASCII characters must be URL encoded.

patch.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case you're updating.

get.summary: Retrieves a paginated subset of cases.
get.description: You must have `read` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the cases you're seeking.

parameters.name: defaultSearchOperator
parameters.description: The default operator to use for the simple_query_string.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The fields in the entity to return in the response.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: [preview] Returns only cases that were created after a specific date. The date must be specified as a KQL data range or date match expression. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of rules to return per page.

parameters.name: reporters
parameters.description: Filters the returned cases by the user name of the reporter.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: An Elasticsearch simple_query_string query that filters the objects in the response.

parameters.name: searchFields
parameters.description: The fields to perform the simple_query_string parsed query against.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Determines which field is used to sort the results.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Determines the sort order.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filters the returned cases by state.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filters the returned cases by tags.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Returns only cases that were created before a specific date. The date must be specified as a KQL data range or date match expression.

get.summary: Returns the cases associated with a specific alert.

id.description: The case identifier.

get.summary: Retrieves external connection details, such as the closure type and default connector for cases.

post.summary: Sets external connection details, such as the closure type and default connector for cases.
post.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case configuration. Connectors are used to interface with external systems. You must create a connector before you can use it in your cases. Refer to the add connectors API. If you set a default connector, it is automatically selected when you create cases in Kibana. If you use the create case API, however, you must still specify all of the connector details.

get.description: In particular, only the connectors that are supported for use in cases are  returned. You must have `read` privileges for the **Actions and Connectors** feature in the **Management** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

get.summary: Returns information about the users who opened cases.
get.description: You must have read privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the cases. The API returns information about the users as they existed at the time of the case creation, including their name, full name, and email address. If any of those details change thereafter or if a user is deleted, the information returned by this API is unchanged.

post.summary: Adds a comment or alert to a case.
post.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case you're creating.

delete.summary: Deletes all comments and alerts from a case.

patch.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case you're updating. NOTE: You cannot change the comment type or the owner of a comment.

get.summary: Retrieves a paginated subset of cases.
get.description: You must have `read` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the cases you're seeking.

parameters.name: defaultSearchOperator
parameters.description: The default operator to use for the simple_query_string.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The fields in the entity to return in the response.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: [preview] Returns only cases that were created after a specific date. The date must be specified as a KQL data range or date match expression. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of rules to return per page.

parameters.name: reporters
parameters.description: Filters the returned cases by the user name of the reporter.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: An Elasticsearch simple_query_string query that filters the objects in the response.

parameters.name: searchFields
parameters.description: The fields to perform the simple_query_string parsed query against.

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Determines which field is used to sort the results.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Determines the sort order.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filters the returned cases by state.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Filters the returned cases by tags.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: [preview] Returns only cases that were created before a specific date. The date must be specified as a KQL data range or date match expression. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

post.summary: Sets external connection details, such as the closure type and default connector for cases.
post.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case configuration. Connectors are used to interface with external systems. You must create a connector before you can use it in your cases. Refer to the add connectors API. If you set a default connector, it is automatically selected when you create cases in Kibana. If you use the create case API, however, you must still specify all of the connector details.

get.description: In particular, only the connectors that are supported for use in cases are returned. You must have `read` privileges for the **Actions and Connectors** feature in the **Management** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

get.summary: Returns information about the users who opened cases.
get.description: You must have read privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the cases. The API returns information about the users as they existed at the time of the case creation, including their name, full name, and email address. If any of those details change thereafter or if a user is deleted, the information returned by this API is unchanged.

post.summary: Adds a comment or alert to a case.
post.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case you're creating.

delete.summary: Deletes all comments and alerts from a case.

owner.name: owner
owner.description: A filter to limit the response to a specific set of applications. If this parameter is omitted, the response contains information about all the cases that the user has access to read.

severity.name: severity
severity.description: The severity of the case.

case_id.name: caseId
case_id.description: The identifier for the case. To retrieve case IDs, use the find cases API. All non-ASCII characters must be URL encoded.

owners.description: The application that owns the cases: Stack Management, Observability, or Elastic Security.

closure_types.description: Indicates whether a case is automatically closed when it is pushed to external systems (`close-by-pushing`) or not automatically closed (`close-by-user`).

alertId.description: The alert identifier. It is required only when `type` is `alert`. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

index.description: The alert index. It is required only when `type` is `alert`. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

rule.description: The rule that is associated with the alert. It is required only when `type` is `alert`. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

id.description: The rule identifier.

name.description: The rule name.

comment.description: The new comment. It is required only when `type` is `user`.

alertId.description: The alert identifier. It is required only when `type` is `alert`. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

id.description: The identifier for the comment. To retrieve comment IDs, use the get comments API.

index.description: The alert index. It is required only when `type` is `alert`. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

rule.description: The rule that is associated with the alert. It is required only when `type` is `alert`. This functionality is in technical preview and may be changed or removed in a future release. Elastic will apply best effort to fix any issues, but features in technical preview are not subject to the support SLA of official GA features.

id.description: The rule identifier.

name.description: The rule name.

version.description: The current comment version. To retrieve version values, use the get comments API.

comment.description: The new comment. It is required only when `type` is `user`.

id.description: The identifier for the comment. To retrieve comment IDs, use the get comments API.

version.description: The current comment version. To retrieve version values, use the get comments API.

create_case_request.summary: Create a security case that uses a Jira connector.

create_case_response.summary: The create case API returns a JSON object that includes the user who created the case and the case identifier, version, and creation time.

update_case_request.summary: Update the case description, tags, and connector.

update_case_response.summary: This is an example response when the case description, tags, and connector were updated.

find_case_response.summary: Retrieve the first five cases with the `tag-1` tag, in ascending order by last update time.

find_connector_response.summary: Retrieve information about the connectors and their settings.

get_reporters_response.summary: A list of three users that opened cases

add_comment_request.summary: Adds a comment to a case.

add_comment_response.summary: The add comment to case API returns a JSON object that contains details about the case and its comments.

update_comment_request.summary: Updates a comment of a case.

update_comment_response.summary: The add comment to case API returns a JSON object that contains details about the case and its comments.
